sub_title: Senior Organism Engineer (SOE1) at Ginkgo Bioworks Netherlands
summary:
Hi! I'm Roy. Fascinated by microbes and practices that exploit their capabilities for human benefit. Currently focussing on fermentation optimization for protein production with fungi.

Feel free to contact me:

Kruyt building, Utrecht, the Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 12, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 8, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': 'Dutch DNA Biotech', 'description': "(Public) MSc Thesis title: 'Itaconic acid production in Aspergillus niger'

Within Dutch DNA Biotech's Organic Acid programme, the fungal production host Aspergillus niger is converted into a heterologous producer of the platform chemical itaconic acid. In this research my main focus was on metabolic pathway engineering by genetic modification in order to improve titer, yield and productivity of itaconic acid.", 'title': 'MSc Research Intern', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': 6077, 'name': 'Leiden University', 'logo': 'https://media.licdn.com/dms/image/C4D0BAQEFlK1wNecYbA/company-logo_400_400/0/1519855876129?e=1700697600&v=beta&t=KwFN5kUM6lyLgjAXaylWnuNQ6g0XLwvWDjTK4Ug_mEg', 'url': 'https://www.linkedin.com/school/leiden-university/', 'employees': {'start': 1001, 'end': 5000}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Van Steenis building, Leiden, the Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 9, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'Leiden University', 'description': "Assisted a Bachelor's course teaching first year biology students basic laboratory skills while learning the fundamentals of molecular biology/chemistry. 

Activities included:
- Gaining teaching-level knowledge on basic molecular biology/chemistry.
- Organising and assisting daily practicals for 140 students.
- Reviewing student assignments, exams and presentations.
- Making video tutorials on basic laboratory practices.", 'title': 'Teaching Assistant', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Institute of Biology Leiden', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Sylvius Laboratory, Leiden, the Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'company': 'Institute of Biology Leiden', 'description': "MSc Thesis title: 'A dual luciferase-based cell wall stress reporter system in Aspergillus niger'

At the Department of Molecular Microbiology and Biotechnology of the Institute of Biology Leiden a luciferase (bioluminescence based) reporter system is established monitoring the cell wall stress response in Aspergillus niger for the high-throughput screening of natural extracts in search for new cell wall acting antifungal compounds. In this research I developed a dual luciferase based reporter system for monitoring of cell viability aimed to improve the existing cell wall stress reporter system.", 'title': 'MSc Research Intern', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'Institute of Biology Leiden', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Sylvius Laboratory, Leiden, the Netherlands', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 7, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'company': 'Institute of Biology Leiden', 'description': "BSc Thesis Title: 'The effect of hairpins on Agrobacterium mediated transformation of plant cells'

At the Molecular and Developmental Genetics department of the Institute of Biology Leiden research is done on Agrobacterium mediated transformation, the process of natural genetic transformation by Agrobacterium tumefaciens. In this research I investigated whether artificial DNA constructs that form a hairpin loop could increase the expression frequency of Agrobacterium T-DNA (transferred DNA) during Agrobacterium mediated transformation of plant cells.", 'title': 'BSc Research Intern', 'employment_type': None}]}]
